title: Date, year, week conversion
text: default functions returns isoyear isoweek today.
code: date_to_isoyear_c() #> [1] "2024" date_to_isoyear_n() #> [1] 2024 date_to_isoweek_c() #> [1] "24" date_to_isoweek_n() #> [1] 24 # provide a date date_to_isoyear_c('2021-01-01') #> [1] "2020" date_to_isoyear_n('2021-01-01') #> [1] 2020 date_to_isoweek_c('2021-01-01') #> [1] "53" date_to_isoweek_n('2021-01-01') #> [1] 53 date_to_isoyearweek_c('2021-08-11') #> [1] "2021-32"

what: Get isoyear/isoweek from a isoyearweek string
title: Date, year, week conversion
text: list isoyearweek can accessed following way.

title: Authors and Citation
text: package proudly brought : Chi Zhang. Author, maintainer. Richard Aubrey White. Author. . Copyright holder. See changelog contributors. ðŸ™

title: Authors and Citation
text: Zhang C, White RA (2024). cstime: Date Time Functions Public Health Purposes. R package version 2024.6.13, https://github.com/csids/cstime, https://www.csids./cstime/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {cstime: Date and Time Functions for Public Health Purposes},   author = {Chi Zhang and Richard Aubrey White},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 2024.6.13, https://github.com/csids/cstime},   url = {https://www.csids.no/cstime/}, }

title: Date and Time Functions for Public Health Purposes
text: cstime provides date time functions public health purposes. cstime provides convenient consistent conversion isoyear isoweek calyear season week addition, cstime provides calendar data reference. Read introduction vignette run help(package="cstime").

title: Date and Time Functions for Public Health Purposes
text: csverse set R packages developed help solve problems frequently occur performing disease surveillance. want install dev versions (access packages havenâ€™t released CRAN), run usethis::edit_r_profile() edit .Rprofile. write : Save file restart R. can now install csverse packages drat repository.
code: options(   repos = structure(c(     CSVERSE = "https://www.csids.no/drat/",     CRAN    = "https://cran.rstudio.com"   )) ) install.packages("cstime")
